Grain.Do: Include cooling and grounding grains like rice (basmati, brown), oats. Aim for 1-2 fist-sized portions per meal.
Grain.Dont: Avoid excessively heating grains like millet, jowar, bajra. Limit to 1 fist-sized portion if consumed.

Legume.Do: Prefer mung beans, masoor dal (red lentils), toor dal. Start with 1/2 cup cooked per day.
Legume.Dont: Limit or avoid chana (chickpeas) and rajma (kidney beans) as they can be heavier and heating. If consumed, limit to 1/4 cup cooked.

Veg.Do: Focus on cooling and hydrating vegetables like cucumber, zucchini, bottle gourd, ash gourd, sweet potatoes, carrots, broccoli. Aim for 1-2 fist-sized portions per meal.
Veg.Dont: Avoid extremely pungent or heating vegetables like radish, onion, garlic, chilies. Limit to small amounts if essential.

Spices.Do: Emphasize cooling spices like coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, cardamom, turmeric. Use in moderation, a pinch to 1/2 teaspoon per dish.
Spices.Dont: Minimize or avoid pitta-aggravating spices like red chili powder, black pepper, mustard seeds, ginger in excess. Limit to a tiny pinch if used.

Leafy veg.Do: Include cooling leafy greens like spinach (cooked well), fenugreek leaves, purslane. Aim for 1/2 fist-sized portion regularly.
Leafy veg.Dont: Avoid bitter greens like kale or arugula in large quantities. If consumed, limit to 1/4 fist-sized portion.

Oil.Do: Use cooling oils like coconut oil, sunflower oil, ghee (if tolerated). Use 1-2 teaspoons per meal.
Oil.Dont: Limit or avoid heating oils like mustard oil, sesame oil, groundnut oil. If used, keep to 1 teaspoon.

Fruits.Do: Opt for sweet, cooling, and juicy fruits like melon, watermelon, grapes, pears, bananas, mangoes (in moderation). Aim for 1-1.5 fist-sized portion per day, preferably between meals.
Fruits.Dont: Avoid sour and acidic fruits like citrus (oranges, lemons in excess), pineapple, berries. If consumed, limit to small portions.

Nuts and Dry fruits.Do: Include soaked almonds (peeled), walnuts in moderation. Aim for 4-6 soaked almonds or 2-3 walnuts per day.
Nuts and Dry fruits.Dont: Avoid roasted or salted nuts. Limit or avoid cashews and pistachios due to their heating nature.

Milk product.Do: Since vegan, focus on plant-based alternatives. Opt for almond milk, coconut milk (unsweetened) in moderation. Aim for 1 cup (240ml) per day.
Milk product.Dont: Avoid soy milk as it can be heating for Pitta. Limit processed vegan dairy alternatives.

Condiments.Do: Include mild chutneys like mint, coriander, coconut (less spicy). Use small amounts, 1-2 teaspoons per meal.
Condiments.Dont: Avoid spicy, sour, or fermented chutneys like tomato chutney, tamarind chutney, or pickles. Limit to occasional small tasting if absolutely desired.
